title: Wirthaus German Food Logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115909im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WirthausLogo_5332.jpg)
  
I know a lot of art deco/jugendstyle similars but no match.  
Any thoughts about what it might be based on? Perhaps something not digitized? Old poster?  
Don

Font: 

 Legrand 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115909/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: donshottype

comments.content:
Hi Don,  
take a look at this old discussion here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/96218](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115909/http:/typophile.com/node/96218 "http://typophile.com/node/96218")

Thanks Fivos for the pointer to Legrand. I found the Rick Mueller and "Font Shop 1999" digitizations at "free" sites as well as a pointer to a digitization by Gerald Gallo being sold under the name Display Art Three [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gallofonts/display-art-three/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115909/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gallofonts/display-art-three/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gallofonts/display-art-three/") Identifont and the major font vendors are blank for Legrand.  
They seem to be independent digitizations of the same source. The Gallo version has a slightly more finished quality than the Mueller, but has far fewer glyphs. The Fontshop 1999 is of poorer quality.  
Don
